cards.definition: What were the original American territories under British rule called?
What was the primary colonial grievance against British rule?
In what year was the Declaration of Independence signed?
Who was the first President and Revolutionary War military leader?
Who was the primary author of the Declaration of Independence?
How many branches of government did the Constitution establish?
Which branch of government is responsible for creating and passing laws?
What is the name for the two houses of the legislative branch?
What are the two houses that make up Congress?
What are the first ten amendments to the Constitution called?
What principle divides government power among three branches?
What group supported ratification of the Constitution and strong federal government?
In which governing body did American colonists lack representation?
What type of legislature has two separate chambers or houses?
What system allows each government branch to limit other branches' power?
What type of law is based on the Constitution's principles?
During which conflict did George Washington serve as military leader?
What type of governing principles formed the basis of American government?
Between which two levels is power shared under federalism?
What does the Bill of Rights guarantee to American citizens?
